headline: Meet with your child’s school to discuss support options
lede: Every school has a special educational needs coordinator, who you should meet with to discuss your child’s progress.
highlights: All schools have an obligation to provide support
Many different kinds of support available

callToAction.label: See the advice
callToAction.text: We’ve prepared some advice to help you have this conversation.

headline: Get independent help to resolve disagreements
lede: Information, Advice and Support Kent can provide independent advice and support to help you along your journey.
highlights: Everything said is confidential and can stay anonymous

callToAction.text: Visit the IASK website to get started.

headline: Explore the help and support available in your local community
lede: There are many voluntary organisations, support groups and advice charities active in Kent that can help you, often for free.
highlights: Wide variety of support available, to suit all situations

callToAction.text: You can search for services and activities online.

headline: Consider whether children’s services can help
lede: If your family is going through a difficult time, our Early Help team may be able to help.
highlights: You don’t have to be at a crisis point to reach out
You may not need an assessment

callToAction.text: Read about how to use children’s services in Kent.

headline: Consider whether an EHC assessment is needed
lede: All schools have an obligation to support pupils with SEN, but everything that’s been tried isn’t working, it could be time to ask for an EHC assessment
highlights: EHC assessments can take up to 20 weeks
Getting an assessment doesn’t guarantee a plan

callToAction.text: Make sure you read about what’s involved before asking for an EHC plan.

headline: Speak to your doctor about physical and mental health support
lede: Because you said you said that physical and mental health symptoms are involved.
highlights: You can access some specialist treatment, like speech therapy, without an EHC plan

callToAction.text: Make an appointment with your GP, or in some situations, the school nurse.
